annotations.description: The fans in the stadium certainly won't regret buying tickets as they witnessed a great game today. The home side dominated the game. In terms of strategy, the hosts were waiting for the right moment to win the ball and launch a counter attack. The visiting side adopted a possession style of football.

annotations.label: substitution

Nolito (Manchester City) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.

annotations.label: time

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: GOAL! Superb work from Aleksandar Kolarov, who plays a vital role in the build up. He squares it to Duran Nolito (Manchester City), who beats Ron Robert Zieler with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 4:2.

annotations.label: substitution
annotations.description: Substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) has come on for Jamie Vardy.

annotations.label: corner

A brilliant cross into the box finds Nolito (Manchester City), who directs his header to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes an astonishing save.
Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) commits a foul and Michael Oliver immediately signals a free kick.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) converts the free kick from about 24 metres out with a perfectly bent shot that ends up inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. What a shot!
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. Manchester City are awarded a free kick.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: GOAL! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 4:0.

Neat passing move from Manchester City in order to create new attacking opportunities.

annotations.description: 22:78 – the ratio of ball possession.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: The game restarts for the second half.

It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has already been more to see prior to the half time break than there is in most games during the full 90 minutes. The home fans will be really pleased with what they've seen from their players so far. The home side relies mostly on counter attacks for their chances, while the away team adopts the opposite approach of possession football.
